page.title: 18Housing in Cronton
page.content: {Housing}The general view of housing is that of an urban area which has steadily grown around the village, and has gained momentum in recent years. {Privately owned}We questioned 69 households, 67 of which owned their own houses. On average each house had 3 bedrooms. All had a garden, most of medium size, on which they planted a lawn and flower beds, few grew food. 55 of the houses had full central heating, and 33 had either full or partial double glazing. Most owners repaired their own property with the help of a contractor for big repairs. {Rented houses}There are two small areas of council owned property in the village. One unusually timber built. The few people we spoke to from there said their homes were well maintained.
